titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Inter-church Club of Baltimore was a multi-denominational organization of clergymen from the Baltimore area. The club was founded in 1905 by Rufus W. Weaver and several other clergymen. The group met regularly to hear papers and addresses on a range of topics.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of records related to the Inter-church Club of Baltimore. Materials include a typed chronology of the club's history, compiled in 1928 from records of the club's secretary; and a notebook of biographies of club members, 1905-1922. Biographies include a photograph, and the member's denomination, education, pastorates, books written, and information about family members.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
